comments:
Sorry, I miss one thing.

When Eclipse show an error message with a checkbox "Remember to do the same 
thing next time" or something like this, I checked that checkbox, and press OK 
button.

Nguyen,

It is likely that the box you saw said "Errors exist in project.  Continue launch?"

I can't recreate your scenario on my install, so I'd like some more information:

1) Did JUnit tests work before this happened?  Will they work now if there are
no compiler errors?
1) Did you select Yes or No in the dialog box presented?
2) Go into Windows > Preferences > Run / Debug > Launching.  Look at the setting
labelled "Continue launch if project contains errors".  What is the current
value?  If you set it to "Prompt", can you recreate the same behavior?

Thanks.
Which build are you using ? Anything in the log file ?
No feedback from the reporter yet and can't reproduce. Setting to remind.

I meet this problem still RC1 and final version still meet it. But it only
happens sometimes. When I meet it, I restart Eclipse and I don't meet it again.
Where can I find the log file? I will report you next time I meet it.

If your workspace is in c:\workspace, the log file will be at
c:\workspace\.metadata\.log

Any insight on the questions in comment 4?  Thanks

Nguyen,

I'm concerned that you're still seeing this problem, and I'd like to figure out
why it's happening.  Since I'm having a difficult time recreating the problem,
it's important that we nail down exactly what's happening.  Please in one
comment, answer both of these questions, using the situation that held the last
time you saw the error:

1) What is the current value of "Continue launch if project contains errors"? 
Is it still "Prompt"?

2) Does this happen only when there are compiler errors in the project being
tested, or at other times?

3) How often does this happen?  Once every five minute, every hour, every day?  

Thanks for your help.

My answer:

1) What is the current value of "Continue launch if project contains errors"? 
Is it still "Prompt"?

It's "Always"


2) Does this happen only when there are compiler errors in the project being 
tested, or at other times?

The last time, it happens when I add a test suite and try to run it. After 
restart Eclipse, it works well.


3) How often does this happen?  Once every five minute, every hour, every day?

Sometimes, it does not happen frequently.

Miss one thing

2) Does this happen only when there are compiler errors in the project being 
tested, or at other times?

The last time, it happens when I add a test suite and try to run it, no 
compling errors. After restart Eclipse, it works well.

Nguyen,

One more question, still about this most recent time you saw the error.  After
you saw this message, did you try to run the tests again before restarting
Eclipse?  Did they always fail the same way?  Thanks.
